content.description:
Start on the two obvious crimps moving left horizontal to the two other crimps. Finding good footing to start is good for right foot, but suspect for the left foot.Throw left hand up to mini jug and work your way up to large jug that's left and up. Find some feet then head up and right to crimps then a far right to ledge (crux is these last few moves mentioned). From there top out with by throwing a heal up and moving a little further to the left and over. If you don't go over the top no worries, has lots of vegetation so can be muddy and slippery.

 Contrived problem, but some good heal hooks and crux at the end. Most problems are easy on this wall, but a pretty decent one for the area. This may already be a problem, but because of all the "not in plays" it may not have been.
content.protection: Easy. One pad, may not even need one.
content.location: Located at the Danger Dam. Sits about 6 feet left (roughly) of the overhang with the tree on top coming out of over the walk lane. Start on the two obvious crimps moving left horizontal to the two other crimps. Finding good footing.

content.description: Start at the bottom of the crack and make a move or two up it. With your right hand established somewhere amongst the very chalked bulge where the crack splits, get yourself set up for a big throw left to the massive left-facing flake. Go big with the left hand, cut feet for style points, and bring your right hand over to match the flake. Finish with a big and easy toss up to the the big ledge directly above the flake, or finish on the Rainbow.The big jug ledge near the end of the crack is off.
content.location: Start at the bottom of the crack to the right side of the cave containing The Rainbow and the Classics (same start as the Classics and Ledges and Edges).

content.description: Start matched on the prominent jug in the middle of the face. Follow the flake up to the right using only the holds along that seam. The shelf at the top is the finish. If you really have something to prove you could probably top it out for a V2 :)
content.location: Middle of the central overhanging portion of the Danger Dam boulder area.

content.description: A fun arete sit starting on the slab, climbing the water streak.
content.protection: Pad, spotter, an eye out for fast bikes!
content.location: In the Main Area of boulders on Lincoln Drive bike path, between Ridge Ave and 100 Steps.

content.description: Start on the big chalked-up ledge and make a big move up to a good hold. Ride the rail rightwards, crossing into the finish of The Rainbow.
content.location: In the cave containing The Rainbow. The route starts on the same hold as Lushes Lip and climbs along the prominent ledge about 7 feet up.

content.description:
Start matched on the horn on the far right. Traverse left along the lip as far as possible then top out. The rock on the bottom left is off.

Beta Vid
content.location: Right around the corner from Rich's Arete

content.description:
Start on the prominent jug farthest to the right. Move up and left on jugs to reach a long shelf. It's a real choose your own adventure kinda thing here, plenty to choose from. Continue traversing left to the same finish as The Rainbow for a V2.

Beta Vid

Fun variation of Iron Cross. Start on the same big ledge and make the same initial moves as Iron Cross, but once you are situated in the pocket, move up into the crimp and make a toss for the big ledge directly above you. Finish on Poison Ivy (traverse the ledge right, into the finishing jug for The Rainbow).
content.location: Start on the chalked-up ledge on the left end of the cave containing The Rainbow and the Classics.

content.description: Start with hands on the big chalked-up ledge. Move right into the crimpy pocket and execute the iron cross into the juggy left-facing flake (the higher crimp between the pocket and flake is off). Finish on The Rainbow.
content.location: The leftmost route in the little cave containing The Rainbow and the Classics.

content.description: Start at the base of the crack and climb it until it peters out (juggy ledges to the left of the crack are off). Move up to a good sloping pocket and then to a sharp crimp pocket above it. Make a big move with the right hand to the small but positive gaston, then fire up for a crimp just below the lip. Finish on the juggy lip.There are three variations/eliminates for this problem; here is a beta video from Rich showing which holds are on.Â
content.protection: pads. The final moves are over the concrete.
content.location: On the right side of the cave containing the Classics and The Rainbow, starting at the bottom of the low crack.

content.description: This problem is only 3 moves, but they are pretty fun ones. Stand start on two parallel holds below the end of Lushes Lip, and climb the face to the right of the arete, using a gaston and nice sculpted sidepull. Finish by matching the top of Rich's Arete.
content.protection: Pad, the problem is above the concrete path. 1 is fine.
content.location: This problem climbs the same feature as Rich's Arete, but on the other side of the arete. Start on two good holds around chest level.

content.description: Sit start at the beginning of the crack system and bust a move up to the prominent jug ledge above the end of the crack. Keep following the good holds into the finish of The Rainbow.
content.location: On the right side of the cave containing the Classics and The Rainbow, starting at the bottom of the low crack.

content.description: This area is known as "The Danger Dam" Area. There was a sign across from the boulder warning about the Dam in the creek below. This is by far the best bouldering area in the city. It has many problems from v1 to v8. There any eliminate variations. There is a proud traverse of the entire area "There and Back Again" V6. (- Rich Shoemaker)
